name: Rainer WIELAND
text: We now come to the first round of voting. We are voting in the final vote on the joint motion for a resolution: new MFF, own resources and reconstruction plan (B9-0158/2020). We are also voting on the amendments on the following topics: financial assistance to partners in the enlargement and neighbourhood countries due to the COVID-19 pandemic [COM(2020)0163 - C9-0119/2020- 2020/0065 (COD)], Temporary measures relating to the implementation of air services [COM(2020)0178 - C9-0124/2020- 2020/0069 (COD)], Temporary measures concerning the validity of certificates and licences, including several measures [COM(2020)0176 - C9-0126/2020- 2020/0068 (COD)], Collection of port charges [COM(2020)0177 - C9-0123/2020- 2020/0067 (COD)] and the 4th Railway Package: Extension of the implementation period [COM(2020)0179 - C9-0125/2020- 2020/0071(COD)]. The vote will be in accordance with the same procedure as on the previous two days. The first round of voting is open from 9.30 a.m. to 10.45 a.m. All votes today are by roll call. Members can see their vote and the results of the votes in the document published today on the plenary session's website. The vote is open. You can vote until 10.45 a.m.  The results will be announced at 1.15 p.m. The sitting is suspended.

name: Rainer WIELAND
text: Unfortunately, I have to reopen the sitting.  I turned over too quickly and flipped a leaf over it. I would like to inform you of the decisions of the AGRI and PECH committees on the opening of interinstitutional negotiations under Article 71(1), which were announced at the opening of the meeting on Wednesday, 13 May 2020: I have received a request from the Verts/ALE Group and several Members, under Article 71(2), to vote on the decision of the AGRI Committee to open negotiations in Parliament.  The vote will take place today at 2.15 p.m.  With regard to the decision of the PECH Committee to open negotiations, I have not received a request for a vote in Parliament. The Committee may therefore open negotiations. I ask for your indulgence.

name: Bas EICKHOUT
text: – Mr President, I just want to explain why we are objecting to the mandate for direct negotiations for CAP reform. We do understand very well that the CAP does of course need to be prolonged and that we need to assure certainty for farmers. However, the Committee on Agriculture and Rural Development (AGRI) has decided that they are prolonging it, instead of for one year, for two years. That makes this a decision about a value in money of EUR 100 billion. That decision has been taken in the AGRI Committee. We as Greens think that deserves a plenary discussion, so that’s what we’re voting on. We’re not voting against the extension. We are voting against the mandate for direct negotiations. We want to negotiate the mandate here in this plenary because a decision on EUR 100 billion should be a debate here in plenary. That’s what we’re voting on and that’s why we are asking all our colleagues to vote against the mandate so that we can have a plenary debate on this issue. That will take place in June, well in time before the decisions will be taken, and I hope on the understanding of my colleagues that they will support this objection so we can vote for a full plenary mandate. The rapporteur said in an email that we need a strong and clear mandate. Well, I can assure you that the strongest mandate you can get is by a plenary mandate. Let’s ensure a plenary mandate in June and, for that, we need to vote against a direct mandate for only the AGRI Committee.

name: Rainer WIELAND
text: Thank you, Mr Eickhout, for the explanations. I hope that you will at least understand my mistake, that I have overlooked this and that you have not been able to raise your important concerns immediately. I assume, however, that this was not a serious procedural error. (The sitting was suspended at 9.38 a.m.)

name: David Maria SASSOLI
text: These are the results of today's first round of voting. Motion for a resolution - New MFF, own resources and recovery plan (B9-0158/2020), final vote: votes: 693; in favour: 505; against: 119; abstentions: 69. Approved. Macro-financial assistance to enlargement and neighbourhood partner countries in the context of the Covid-19 pandemic crisis [COM(2020)0178 - C9-0124/2020- 2020/0069(COD)]: Amendment 1 rejected; Amendment No 2 rejected; Amendment No 3 was rejected. Temporary measures concerning the provision of air services [COM(2020)0178 - C9-0124/2020- 2020/0069(COD)]: Amendment 28 rejected; Amendment No 7 rejected; Amendments Nos 1, 9, 15 and 21 adopted; Amendments Nos 2, 10, 16 and 22 adopted; Amendments Nos 3, 17, 23 adopted; Amendment No 29 was rejected; Amendments Nos 4, 12, 18 and 24 adopted; Amendments Nos 5, 13, 19, 25 adopted; Amendments Nos 6, 14, 20 and 26 adopted; Amendments Nos 8, 27 adopted. Temporary measures concerning the validity of certain certificates and licences (omnibus) [COM(2020)0176 - C9-0126/2020- 2020/0068(COD)]: Amendments 4, 5, 6, 9, 10, 11 adopted; Amendments Nos 1 and 7 were rejected; Amendment No 3 rejected; Amendments Nos 4, 5, 6, 9, 10 and 11 have been adopted; Amendments Nos 2 and 8 were rejected. Port infrastructure usage charges [COM(2020)0177 - C9-0123/2020- 2020/0067(COD)]: Amendment 1 rejected; Amendment No 16 was rejected; Amendments Nos 3, 5, 9 and 11 adopted; Amendment No 12 was rejected; Amendments Nos 6, 13 were rejected; Amendments Nos 7, 14 were rejected; Amendment No 17 was rejected; Amendments Nos 2, 4, 8, 10 and 15 adopted. Fourth railway package: extension of transposition periods (COM(2020)0179 - C9-0125/2020- 2020/0071(COD)): Amendments 4, 14, 25 adopted; Amendments Nos 5, 15 and 26 adopted; Amendments Nos 6, 16 and 27 adopted; Amendments Nos 7, 17, 28 adopted; Amendments Nos 18, 29 adopted; Amendments Nos 8, 19 and 30 adopted; Amendments Nos 9, 20 and 31 adopted; Amendments Nos 10, 21 and 32 adopted; Amendments Nos 1, 11 and 22 adopted; Amendments Nos 2, 12 and 23 adopted; Amendments Nos 3, 13 and 24 adopted. These were the results of the votes. (The sitting was suspended at 1.26 p.m.)

name: Rainer WIELAND
text: We come to the second round of voting today. We are voting on the decision of the AGRI Committee to open interinstitutional negotiations on transitional arrangements for support from the European Agricultural Fund for Rural Development (EEER) and the European Agricultural Guarantee Fund (EAGGF) in 2021 (COM(2019)0581 – C9-0162/2019 - 2019/0254(COD)). Rapporteur: Elsi Katainen (A9-0101/2020). We shall vote at the request of the Group of the Greens/European Free Alliance. Their representatives have already justified this this morning. Before the vote, only one speaker can speak in favour of the committee's decision to open negotiations and one speaker against that decision.

name: Norbert LINS
text: Mr President, I would like to thank the I would also like to make this speech on behalf of Mrs Katainen, the rapporteur on this dossier. I am already slightly soured at how you play your political games here on the backs of the farmers. The same Members who, almost two weeks ago, unanimously and without voting against or abstaining, adopted this proposal in committee are now trying to delay this dossier, which must be dealt with with great urgency. But there seems to be, thank God, a coalition of reasonable and decent people who have recognized what to do at this difficult time, and there are those who, despite Corona, persist in their ideologies. We are talking here about the sector that is currently in crisis, ensuring that we all have enough to eat on the table, even though we are currently in the worst health and economic crisis since the Second World War. Agriculture is being hit by severe market disruptions. On the one hand, bold market intervention is needed, and on the other hand, our farmers need reliability – something that we can achieve with the text to be voted on today. To call for a mini-CAP reform here, in order to present the next changes to farmers in a forthcoming two years' time, is, in my view, a bureaucratic madness. Let it be good! We have been negotiating the new agricultural policy for a long time. Bring your arguments there! What we need now is legal certainty, is planning certainty for our agriculture for the next one to two years. I therefore appeal: let us vote in favour of the text proposed here and in favour of extending the current legal framework. We will then be able to discuss what will be in the new CAP in the ongoing negotiations. Let us not let agriculture hang here! Our farmers will thank us.

name: Rainer WIELAND
text: We will vote on it in a matter of time. In addition, we will vote in the final vote on financial assistance to partners in the enlargement and neighbourhood countries due to the COVID-19 pandemic [COM(2020)0163 - C9-0119/2020- 2020/0065 (COD)], on temporary measures relating to the implementation of air services [COM(2020)0178 - C9-0124/2020- 2020/0069 (COD)], on temporary measures concerning the validity of certificates and licences (several measures) [COM(2020)0176 - C9-0126/2020- 2020/0068 (COD)], on port infrastructure charges [COM(2020)0177 - C9-0123/2020- 2020/0067 (COD)] and on the 4th Railway Package: extension of the implementation period [COM(2020)0179 - C9-0125/2020- 2020/0071 (COD)]. The vote will take place in accordance with the same procedure as this morning. The second round of voting is open from 2.15 p.m. to 3.30 p.m. The vote is now open. You can vote until 3.30 p.m. The results of the second round of voting will be announced at 5.30 p.m. (The sitting was suspended at 2.19 p.m.)

name: Rainer WIELAND
text: Mr President, ladies and gentlemen, I would like to thank the rapporteur for his excellent report, which The Renew Europe Group has sent the President decisions amending nominations for a committee. The decisions will be published in the minutes of today's sitting and will take effect on the day of this announcement.  The results of today's second round of voting are: financial assistance to partners in the enlargement and neighbourhood countries resulting from the COVID-19 pandemic [COM(2020)0163 - C9-0119/2020- 2020/0065(COD)]: the Commission's proposal has been adopted; Temporary measures relating to the implementation of air services [COM(2020)0178 - C9-0124/2020- 2020/0069 (COD)]: the Commission's proposal has also been adopted; Temporary measures concerning the validity of certificates and licences (several measures) [COM(2020)0176 - C9-0126/2020- 2020/0068 (COD)]: here too the Commission's proposal has been adopted; Collection of port charges [COM(2020)0177 - C9-0123/2020- 2020/0067 (COD)]: Here too the Commission's proposal has been adopted, and the 4th Railway Package: Extension of the implementation period [COM(2020)0179 - C9-0125/2020- 2020/0071 (COD)]- and finally, the transitional rules for support from the European Agricultural Fund for Rural Development (EEER) and the European Agricultural Guarantee Fund (EAGGF) in 2021 (COM(2019)0581 - C9-0162/2019 - 2019/0254 (COD)). Rapporteurs: Elsi Katainen (A9-0101/2020): Here the decision of the Committee on Agriculture and Rural Development on the opening of interinstitutional negotiations was adopted, that is to say, the decision was confirmed at the request of a political group, and thus the negotiators can enter into negotiations for the committee or for the whole House. Due to the results of the previous voting rounds, there is no longer a third round of voting today. The minutes of the meetings of 13, 14 and 15 May will be submitted to Parliament for approval at the beginning of the next session. If there are no objections, I will pass on the resolutions adopted in This week's session of Parliament to the persons and bodies mentioned in these resolutions.

name: Rainer WIELAND
text: I declare the session of the European Parliament adjourned.
